meanings.definition: To make a fool of or embarrass someone.
meanings.sent1: He beclowned his friend by telling embarrassing stories at the party.
meanings.sent2: She beclowned her brother by sharing his childhood photos online.
meanings.sent3: The comedian beclowned the audience with his hilarious jokes.
meanings.sent4: The prank backfired, and he ended up beclowned in front of everyone.
meanings.sent5: The magician's failed trick beclowned him in front of the entire crowd.

meanings.definition: To be humiliated or embarrassed in a public manner.
meanings.sent1: After tripping on stage, he felt beclowned in front of the audience.
meanings.sent2: She was beclowned when her presentation slides had embarrassing typos.
meanings.sent3: The politician beclowned himself with his awkward dance moves at the rally.
meanings.sent4: The team's defeat beclowned them in the eyes of their fans.
meanings.sent5: The viral video of his fall beclowned him on social media.
